verses.verse: A Psalm of David. <WH1732> Blessed <WH1288> be the LORD <WH3068> my strength, <WH6697> which teacheth <WH3925> my hands <WH3027> to war, <WH7128> and my fingers <WH676> to fight: <WH4421>

My goodness, <WH2617> and my fortress; <WH4686> my high tower, <WH4869> and my deliverer; <WH6403> my shield, <WH4043> and he in whom I trust; <WH2620> who subdueth <WH7286> my people <WH5971> under <WH8478> me.
LORD, <WH3068> what <WH4100> is man, <WH120> that thou takest knowledge <WH3045> of him! or the son <WH1121> of man, <WH582> that thou makest account <WH2803> of him!
Man <WH120> is like <WH1819> to vanity: <WH1892> his days <WH3117> are as a shadow <WH6738> that passeth away. <WH5674>
Bow <WH5186> thy heavens, <WH8064> O LORD, <WH3068> and come down: <WH3381> touch <WH5060> the mountains, <WH2022> and they shall smoke. <WH6225>
Cast forth <WH1299> lightning, <WH1300> and scatter <WH6327> them: shoot out <WH7971> thine arrows, <WH2671> and destroy <WH2000> them.

Send <WH7971> thine hand <WH3027> from above; <WH4480> <WH4791> rid <WH6475> me, and deliver <WH5337> me out of great <WH7227> waters, <WH4480> <WH4325> from the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of strange <WH5236> children; <WH1121>
Whose <WH834> mouth <WH6310> speaketh <WH1696> vanity, <WH7723> and their right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood. <WH8267>
I will sing <WH7891> a new <WH2319> song <WH7892> unto thee, O God: <WH430> upon a psaltery <WH5035> and an instrument of ten strings <WH6218> will I sing praises <WH2167> unto thee.
It is he that giveth <WH5414> salvation <WH8668> unto kings: <WH4428> who delivereth <WH6475> <WH853> David <WH1732> his servant <WH5650> from the hurtful <WH7451> sword. <WH4480> <WH2719>

Rid <WH6475> me, and deliver <WH5337> me from the hand <WH4480> <WH3027> of strange <WH5236> children, <WH1121> whose <WH834> mouth <WH6310> speaketh <WH1696> vanity, <WH7723> and their right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood: <WH8267>

That <WH834> our sons <WH1121> may be as plants <WH5195> grown up <WH1431> in their youth; <WH5271> that our daughters <WH1323> may be as corner stones, <WH2106> polished <WH2404> after the similitude <WH8403> of a palace: <WH1964>

That our garners <WH4200> may be full, <WH4392> affording <WH6329> all manner of store: <WH4480> <WH2177> <WH413> <WH2177> that our sheep <WH6629> may bring forth thousands <WH503> and ten thousands <WH7231> in our streets: <WH2351>

That our oxen <WH441> may be strong to labor; <WH5445> that there be no <WH369> breaking in, <WH6556> nor <WH369> going out <WH3318>; that there be no <WH369> complaining <WH6682> in our streets. <WH7339>
Happy <WH835> is that people, <WH5971> that is in such a case: <WH7945> <WH3602> yea, happy <WH835> is that people, <WH5971> whose God <WH430> is the LORD. <WH7945> <WH3068>
